file_content.text: I'll take care of the Shock Drum. Inform General Var Suthra of our status.
Quiet, finally... I can breathe again. I've been down here so long....
Shh, Master. Let us help you.
Kira... and Orgus's Padawan. You're both... changed. What has happened?
Orgus's Padawan... but I left you on Coruscant. What's happened?
All that matters right now is you're safe.
Save your strength.
Darth Angral has declared war against the Republic. He killed Master Orgus.
Orgus is dead.
My oldest friend. May the Force preserve him.
Darth Angral wants revenge. He sent his apprentices to attack you and Master Orgus. We must go to Alderaan.
Orgus needs us.
Forgive me, but I am not much use to anyone.
Darth Angral wants to destroy the Republic. You're going to help me stop him.
Pull yourself together.
I am in no condition to face a Sith Lord.
I only survived this weapon by withdrawing into a deep trance. The Force itself became my armor.
Sustaining the trance cost me greatly. My strength is a fraction of what it was.
What you did was miraculous. We'll handle things from here.
Rest easy, Master Kiwiiks.
You could use a doctor.
The injuries I've sustained can only be healed by time and meditation.
I need the power to survive these conditions. Show me how you did it.
Teach me this trance.
Someday, when I am well enough to lead you through the trance....
I know you faced terrible dangers for me. I will not forget that.
Here you are... I was coming to help when sensors indicated the Shock Drum stopped. You did it.
But poor Brrik's family. I saw them in the cavern. What happened?
Brrik being convinced to distract Sand Demon--giving Jedi advantage.
Sand Demon destroying Brrik's brothers. Brrik being all alone now.
I begged you to protect them--and you used them as cannon fodder!
The Sand Demon was between us and the Shock Drum. We had no choice.
That was never my intention.
I used poor judgment.
At least you have the decency to admit it.
You'd all be dead if not for me. Respect that.
Don't question me.
Please, we must not let emotions overwhelm us.
Brrik, I'm so sorry.
Brrik hurting inside and out.
Our mourning must wait until the present dangers are passed.
Brrik wasn't exaggerating about the Sand Demon. I've never seen anything like it.
I almost hated having to destroy it.
What a shame it had to die.
Sand Demon eating many Brrik's relatives in times past. Brrik thanking Jedi for avenging them!
Brrik was almost a meal for it. Good thing I got here in time.
I kept your friends safe.
That's the second time you've saved our little family. Thank you.
And let this be a lesson to you, Brrik. No more running off pretending to be a hero.
From now on, Brrik keeping far from trouble!
One less nasty beast. It won't be missed.
Good riddance to it.
Sand Demon eating many of Brrik's relatives. Brrik thinking Jedi great hero!
My friends, the danger is not yet passed....
Even deactivated, that weapon remains a threat. You understand the situation best. What should we do?
This technology can't fall into the wrong hands again. Let's collapse the cavern network with explosives.
Bury it forever.
What? All that work--the people who died protecting it....
Think how many more would've died. The galaxy is better off without such weapons.
The general can clean this up. We have other problems.
Let Var Suthra decide.
I will stay and guard it until Republic forces arrive. This cavern's silence will be... refreshing.
If we can get it out of here, this weapon could defeat the Empire.
We need the Shock Drum.
I'm sure General Var Suthra can move the Shock Drum somewhere the Sith won't find it.
Brrik, I'll have to go. Will you come with me?
Brrik having no reason to stay. Hare'en being only family.
I'll have to go with it, Brrik. Would you and your family enjoy seeing more of the galaxy?
Brrik's family following Hare'en anywhere! Exciting!
I will see to the Shock Drum. You should return to your ship and inform General Var Suthra what's happened.
With the Sand Demon dead and Imperials gone, you should be safe.
As you wish, Master.
Master, you've just been through a terrible ordeal. Will you be alright?
Is it safe to leave you?
Do not concern yourself with my welfare. I am still a Jedi.
I'm leaving you with a lot of responsibility. You'd better be up for it.
Don't fail me.
I was a Jedi Master before you were born. I'll be fine.
Before we go... you need to know something, and I'd rather you hear it from me.
I never told you about my childhood. I'm not who you think I am....
So much about you is now clear to me, Kira. But you're wrong about one thing.
You are exactly who I think--a strong, capable young woman. One day, you'll be a great Jedi.
If you could see what she's accomplished, you'd be proud.
I agree.
I wish I shared your confidence.
We'll see about that.
Maybe I should stay with Master Kiwiiks.
You're needed elsewhere, Kira. Consider impressing your new Master with your final trial.
If you really believe that, finish her training.
Then take her off my hands.
There is nothing I can teach her in my present state. Besides, you still need her.
We'll meet again on Tython. May the Force be with you.
[Master Kiwiiks is non-responsive. She appears to be in a catatonic state.]
I must speak with my associate. Perhaps later....
